Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Dish
Description: One the many dishes with a flat base, flared body ending in a flat-edged lip, produced during the Middle Kingdom. The clay is coarse, common, orange and has been polished. This was done more carefully on the inside, the surface of which has also been covered with a light reddish slip and a more obvious red line.
